title: A Timeline of Legal Battles Over Trump’s Use of the Alien Enemies Act
summary: Challenges to the administration’s use of the 18th-century wartime law have gone all the way to the Supreme Court. Here’s where they stand.

title: An Intensified Push for the Epstein Files, and Google’s Big Monopoly Ruling
summary: Plus, a post-mortem on the summer box office.

title: Claudia Sheinbaum Walks a Political Tightrope as Rubio Visits Mexico
summary: U.S. pressure to crack down on corrupt politicians has squeezed President Claudia Sheinbaum of Mexico ahead of her meeting with Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Trump Says U.S. Attacked Boat Carrying Venezuelan Gang Members, Killing 11
summary: The vessel was transporting illegal narcotics through international waters to the United States, the president said.

title: Xi Parades Firepower to Signal That China Won’t Be Bullied Again
summary: The parade, attended by the leaders of Russia and North Korea, had a defiant message. President Trump fired back, accusing Xi Jinping of ignoring America’s role in World War II.

title: Kim Jong-un Brings His Daughter and Potential Heir, Kim Ju-ae, to Beijing
summary: Kim Ju-ae’s presence at a major gathering of world leaders is the latest sign that North Korea’s dictator considers her a successor, analysts said.

title: China’s Military Spectacle
summary: China used a parade of fighter jets, missiles and goose-stepping troops to honor the country’s wartime sacrifice and issue a defiant warning to rivals.

title: Google Must Share Search Data With Rivals, Judge Rules in Antitrust Case
summary: Judge Amit P. Mehta said the company must hand over some of its search data to rivals, but did not force other big changes the U.S. wanted.

title: What Will Happen to Google After the Antitrust Ruling?
summary: The judge’s decision positions Google to keep its search business running largely without interruption.

title: What the Fixes for Google’s Search Monopoly Mean for You: It’s a ‘Nothingburger’
summary: A federal judge’s remedy stops short of making meaningful changes to how we use our phones, computers and the web.

title: As Zohran Mamdani’s Stature Grows, He Tries to Shed Some Past Stances
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, once called for defunding the police and decriminalizing prostitution. He says he has changed.

title: The Cloudy Outlook for New York City’s Economy
summary: Employers are adding far fewer jobs, and even the health care sector could soften. But the city’s economy appears stronger than those on the West Coast.

title: Trump Responds to Rumors About His Health During Oval Office Press Conference
summary: In the world of presidential health, distrust and speculation run so rampant that even Mr. Trump’s online assurance that he was fine was immediately explained away as part of a cover-up.

title: House Oversight Panel Releases Some Epstein Files as Pressure Mounts
summary: The move came as Republican leaders pressed colleagues not to force a vote on disclosing all the material. Most of what was released on Tuesday was not new.

title: Trump to Welcome Poland’s Right-Wing President to White House
summary: The meeting between President Trump and Poland’s largely ceremonial president, Karol Nawrocki, highlights divisions within the biggest economic and military power on the European Union’s eastern fringe.

title: Years After Japan’s Nuclear Disaster, People With Cancer Seek Answers
summary: A survey has found hundreds of thyroid tumors, but Japanese officials say they are unrelated to the Fukushima meltdowns. Now they face a lawsuit.

title: Dan Kleban Joins Maine Democratic Primary, Seeking to Unseat Senator Susan Collins
summary: Dan Kleban enters a crowded Democratic primary as party leaders wait for Maine’s Democratic governor, Janet Mills, who is “seriously considering” a run for Senate.

title: A Kennedy, a Protégé and a Progressive Star Eye Nadler’s N.Y. House Seat
summary: Representative Jerrold Nadler’s departure is still 16 months away, but Democrats are already testing the waters in what is expected to be a highly contested race.

title: The Endangered Leopard Frog That Lives Next to an NYC Amazon Warehouse
summary: The Atlantic Coast leopard frog, first identified in an industrial section of Staten Island in 2012, is now on the state’s endangered species list. Conservation groups see an opportunity.

title: Can Trump Build or Just Demolish? We’re About to Find Out.
summary: What comes next?

title: How to Rethink A.I.
summary: Building bigger A.I. isn’t leading to better A.I.

title: A Protest in China Doubles as Performance Art
summary: We explore an act of defiance in China. But first, a look at President Trump’s health.

title: Far-right Israeli Minister Calls for West Bank Annexation
summary: Bezalel Smotrich said Israel should take over most of the territory,  partly in response to growing international moves to recognize a Palestinian state.

title: Missouri Legislators To Start Special Session on Redistricting
summary: The lawmakers, led by a Republican majority, are expected to consider new maps that would help Republicans gain another seat in Congress. They already hold six of the state’s eight congressional seats.

title: Wildfire Destroys Buildings in Gold Rush Town of Chinese Camp
summary: Fires, likely sparked by lightning strikes that hit California early Tuesday, razed over 9,000 acres in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada Mountains, officials said.

title: Nemat Shafik, Columbia President During Protests, Takes Another Tough Job
summary: Dr. Shafik, who came under fire for her handling of pro-Palestinian campus protests last year, is now the chief economic adviser to Britain’s prime minister.
